Competitions

Experienced RSO may be tasked to act as RSO at official marksmanship competitions. The rules and competition details for cadet competitions are found in A-CR-CCP-177/PT-001 Cadet Marksmanship Program Reference Guide, as well as in the operation order (or similar direction) for the event.

 

Even though set-up used at marksmanship competitions can be very complex or technical, the job of the RSO remains the same – to ensure a safe set-up, to supervise the participants (shooters, coaches, staff, etc.), and to control the placement and movement of equipment on the range.

Competitive marksmanship equipment:

 

•Shooting jackets, gloves and hats

•Electronic targets

 

 

Click here to watch a video of range commands for a marksmanship competition.  (approx. 4 mins)

 

 

Biathlon

 

In some situations, an official cadet biathlon competition may be conducted using air rifles. Rules and details for biathlon competitions can be found in A-CR-CCP-178/PT-001 Cadet Biathlon Program Reference Guide.

These pieces of clothing are specifically designed to assist the shooter to hold a comfortable, firm position and improve accuracy.

 

The coach will assist a shooter with their equipment, while the RSO will ensure that equipment does not interfere with range operation or safety (e.g. ensure participants remove all their equipment from the firing point when their relay is complete.

Shooting jackets, gloves and hats

High level cadet competitions may use electronic targets and monitors to provide participants with accurate and detailed feedback on their shooting.

Electronic targets
